Stereotype.name: physicaldimension
Stereotype.notes:
This class represents a physical dimension. If the physical dimension of two units is identical, then a conversion between them is possible. The conversion between units is related to the definition of the physical dimension.
Note that the equivalence of the exponents does not per se define the convertibility. For example Energy and Torque share the same exponents (Nm).
Please note further the value of an exponent does not necessarily have to be an integer number. It is also possible that the value yields a rational number, e.g. to compute the square root of a given physical quantity. In this case the exponent value would be a rational number where the numerator value is 1 and the denominator value is 2.

Tag.name: currentExp
Tag.description: This attribute represents the exponent of the physical dimension "electric current".

Tag.name: lengthExp
Tag.description: The exponent of the physical dimension "length".

Tag.name: luminousIntensityExp
Tag.description: The exponent of the physical dimension "luminous intensity".

Tag.name: massExp
Tag.description: The exponent of the physical dimension "mass".

Tag.name: molarAmountExp
Tag.description: The exponent of the physical dimension "quantity of substance".

Tag.name: temperatureExp
Tag.description: The exponent of the physical dimension "temperature".

Tag.name: timeExp
Tag.description: The exponent of the physical dimension "time".

Tag.name: firstPhysicalDimension
Tag.description: This represents the first PhysicalDimension of the enclosing PhysicalDimensionMapping.

Tag.name: secondPhysicalDimension
Tag.description: This represents the first PhysicalDimension of the enclosing PhysicalDimensionMapping.

Stereotype.name: unit
Stereotype.notes:
This is a physical measurement unit. All units that might be defined should stem from SI units. In order to convert one unit into another factor and offset are defined. For the calculation from SI-unit to the defined unit the factor (factorSiToUnit ) and the offset (offsetSiToUnit ) are applied as follows:
x [{unit}] := y * [{siUnit}] * factorSiToUnit [[unit]/{siUnit}] + offsetSiToUnit [{unit}]
For the calculation from a unit to SI-unit the reciprocal of the factor (factorSiToUnit ) and the negation of the offset (offsetSiToUnit ) are applied.
y {siUnit} := (x*{unit} - offsetSiToUnit [{unit}]) / (factorSiToUnit [[unit]/{siUnit}]
Tags:atp.recommendedPackage=Units

Tag.name: displayName
Tag.description: This specifies how the unit shall be displayed in documents or in user interfaces of tools.The displayName corresponds to the Unit.Display in an ASAM MCD-2MC file.

Tag.name: factorSiToUnit
Tag.description: This is the factor for the conversion from SI Units to units. The inverse is used for conversion from units to SI Units.

Tag.name: offsetSiToUnit
Tag.description: This is the offset for the conversion from and to siUnits.

Tag.name: phyiscalDimension
Tag.description: This association represents the physical dimension to which the unit belongs to. Note that only values with units of the same physical dimensions might be converted.

Stereotype.name: unitgroup
Stereotype.notes:
This meta-class represents the ability to specify a logical grouping of units.The category denotes the unit system that the referenced units are associated to.
In this way, e.g. country-specific unit systems (CATEGORY="COUNTRY") can be defined as well as specific unit systems for certain application domains.
In the same way a group of equivalent units, can be defined which are used in different countries, by setting CATEGORY="EQUIV_UNITS". KmPerHour and MilesPerHour could such be combined to one group named "vehicle_speed". The unit MeterPerSec would not belong to this group because it is normally not used for vehicle speed. But all of the mentioned units could be combined to one group named "speed".
Note that the UnitGroup does not ensure the physical compliance of the units. This is maintained by the physical dimension.

Tag.name: unit
Tag.description: This represents one particular unit in the UnitGroup.
